net.mdwright.var

Class ModelBuildingVar

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.mdwright.var.ModelBuildingVar
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VarCalculator

    public class ModelBuildingVar
extends java.lang.Object
implements VarCalculator
    Class for performing complex value at risk calculations using the model-building methodology.

      • calculateVar

        public java.math.BigDecimal calculateVar(Portfolio portfolio,
                                         int timeHorizon,
                                         double probability)
        Method to calculate VaR for a portfolio using the historical sim model.
        Specified by:
        calculateVar in interface VarCalculator
        Parameters:
        portfolio - An array of Positions containing ticker symbols and values for each position in the portfolio
        timeHorizon - An int value representing the number of days to calculate VaR over
        probability - A double value representing the percentage probability in decimal form
        Returns:
        BigDecimal value representing the VaR of the portfolio

      • calculateVar

        public java.math.BigDecimal calculateVar(Portfolio portfolio,
                                         int timeHorizon,
                                         double probability,
                                         VolatilityMethod volatilityChoice)
        Method to calculate VaR for a portfolio using the model-building model.
        Specified by:
        calculateVar in interface VarCalculator
        Parameters:
        portfolio - An array of Positions containing ticker symbols and values for each position in the portfolio
        timeHorizon - An int value representing the of days to calculate VaR over
        probability - A double value representing the percentage probability in decimal form
        volatilityChoice - Enum representing the desired variance method to be used
        Returns:
        BigDecimal value representing the VaR of the portfolio

      • calculateVarSingle

        public java.math.BigDecimal calculateVarSingle(Portfolio portfolio,
                                               int timeHorizon,
                                               double probability,
                                               VolatilityMethod volatilityChoice)
        Method to calculate VaR for 1 stock.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - Portfolio object containing a singular position
        timeHorizon - number of days as an integer to act as the time horizon
        probability - A double value representing the percentage probability in decimal form
        volatilityChoice - Enum representing the variance method to be used
        Returns:
        BigDecimal value representing the VaR of the single stock portfolio

      • calculateVarDouble

        public java.math.BigDecimal calculateVarDouble(Portfolio portfolio,
                                               int timeHorizon,
                                               double probability,
                                               VolatilityMethod volatilityChoice)
        Method to calculate VaR for 2 stocks.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - Portfolio object containing two positions
        timeHorizon - number of days as an integer to act as the time horizon
        probability - A double value representing the percentage probability in decimal form
        volatilityChoice - Enum object representing the variance method to be used
        Returns:
        BigDecimal value representing the VaR of the two stock portfolio

      • calculateVarLinear

        public java.math.BigDecimal calculateVarLinear(Portfolio portfolio,
                                               int timeHorizon,
                                               double probability,
                                               VolatilityMethod volatilityChoice)
        Method to calculate value at risk using the linear covariance method.
        Parameters:
        portfolio - Portfolio object containing associated positions
        timeHorizon - number of days as an integer to act as the time horizon
        probability - A double value representing the percentage probability in decimal form
        volatilityChoice - Enum value representing the volatility calculation to be used
        Returns:
        A BigDecimal value representing the value at risk across the time horizon and at a certain probability
